abstract: Op-Ed article by Jonathan Zimmerman cautions that it is wrong to blame schools for not doing more to educate students about so-called sexting, as some have done in wake of revelations that 100 students at high school in Colorado regularly engaged in practice; suggests such response is in keeping with long but misguided tradition of relying on schools to clean up perceived sexual crises; proposes using text-messaging services to educate students about dangers of practice.
lead_paragraph: There are serious risks associated with teenagers exchanging nude photos but it isn’t the dangerous scourge that most adults imagine.

headline.main: Schools Can’t Stop Kids From Sexting. More Technology Can.
headline.print_headline: A Solution to Sexting? More Texting
